instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B graphic issue after GPU replacement
threads.message:
Hi guys!

I have this motherboard and after Gpu replacement is showing pink color on the image. When i touch the board when is switch on, the color on the screen changes.

Please check out the video.

[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A35mzVFl1oE[/url]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B graphic issue after GPU replacement
threads.message: Put some light pressure on Gmux. See if image changes ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B graphic issue after GPU replacement
threads.message: Press on <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> and see if symptom changes. If yes clean the edge bonding REALLY well and give it a reflow. If that fails, have fun reballing it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B graphic issue after GPU replacement
threads.message: I did some pressing on <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> that did not change anything. However, pressing on VRAM was giving me changes on the screen. I have reflowed VRAMs and now everything seems to work fine. I hope for a long time. Problem solved, for now...
